articles.title: 5 restaurants we can’t wait to try in February
articles.description:
From Canotto-style pizza in South Boston to a new ocean-to-table spot in Watertown, these restaurants are topping our must-try list this month.

The post 5 restaurants we can’t wait to try in February  appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Discover five new restaurants opening in February across Boston and nearby areas.
Try Canotto-style pizza in South Boston and an ocean-to-table spot in Watertown.
These new dining options enhance Boston's culinary scene for local food enthusiasts.

articles.title: Panera to close bakery facility in Franklin, lay off nearly 100 workers
articles.description:
The fast-casual chain says it will shift to “par-baked” goods from artisan bakeries to offer consistent quality throughout the day.

The post Panera to close bakery facility in Franklin, lay off nearly 100 workers appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Panera will close its Franklin bakery facility by February 2026.
Nearly 100 workers will be laid off due to the closure.
Boston residents may see changes in product availability and quality at local Panera locations.

articles.title: 16-year-old New Zealander ran a 3:48 mile at BU’s Terrier Classic, set a junior world record
articles.description:
Sam Ruthe set a New Zealand mile record outright, and also a world record for anyone under the age of 18.

The post 16-year-old New Zealander ran a 3:48 mile at BU’s Terrier Classic, set a junior world record appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Sam Ruthe, 16, set a junior world record with a 3:48 mile at BU's Terrier Classic.
This performance broke New Zealand's mile record and the global record for athletes under 18.
Boston's Terrier Classic gains recognition as a premier event for emerging track talent.

articles.title: Grammy Awards 2026: Check out the winners
articles.description:
Bad Bunny won album of the year and Kendrick Lamar and SZA took home record of the year for “luther” at Sunday's Grammy Awards.

The post Grammy Awards 2026: Check out the winners appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bad Bunny won Album of the Year at the 2026 Grammy Awards.
Kendrick Lamar and SZA received Record of the Year for 'Luther'.
Boston artists gain recognition as major winners influence local music scene.

articles.title: Photos: Grammy Awards’ biggest moments and fashion standouts
articles.description:
Music’s biggest night featured historic victories, viral performances, and bold red carpet style.

The post Photos: Grammy Awards’ biggest moments and fashion standouts appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Grammy Awards showcased Boston artists, enhancing local cultural pride and visibility.
Historic wins included Boston's own John Legend, contributing to local music recognition.
Fashion moments from the event influence local trends and inspire Boston's fashion scene.

articles.title: Livestream: Ms. G, Massachusetts’ official groundhog, to make annual prediction
articles.description:
Early spring or more winter? The state's own Ms. G weighs in.

The post Livestream: Ms. G, Massachusetts’ official groundhog, to make annual prediction appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Ms. G, Massachusetts' official groundhog, will make her prediction on February 2, 2026.
Residents await Ms. G's forecast for early spring or continued winter weather.
The prediction influences local events and activities in Boston for the upcoming season.
